messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:34): is there any other WebSocket demo besides the one from Hixie?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:34): I wonder what is enabled in Minefield
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:35): someone made claims on hybi, but I'm sceptical
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:39): I think -76 is currently enabled in Minefield
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:40): The claim was that this would be disabled or prefixed
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:43): right
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:43): I'm not buying that at all
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:43): which means we might be stuck with -76 forever at the current rate the IETF is doing things
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:44): Well yeah I said that back in July
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:45): And they eventually agreed in mid August to finish stuff on a four week timescale
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:45): That has not happened
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:45): yeah
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:45): fail
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:46): they don't even have an open bug as far as I can tell related to the claims of that guy
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:48): not much traffic either on hybi recently

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:48): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, SVG in text/html has case-insensitive element and attribute names . . . but you're saying that by the time they get to the DOM they're canonical case, so CSS should be case-sensitive?  But HTML elements and attributes are lowercased before getting to the DOM in text/html, so how is that different?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:48): It is of course not impossible it will happen
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:48): But I agree there is not a great deal of evidence for it
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:48): (Does HTML define whether CSS should be case-sensitive for text/html?)
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (18:49): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I did this demo and it still works in Minefield
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (18:49): http://ssh.alwaysdata.com:11801/
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:49): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, it is different because SVG uses camel case element names and to keep performance happy you want pointer comparison
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:50): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, okay, so is this difference specced anywhere?  I don't see it immediately.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:50): XHR is consistently faster in Firefox, 4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9? :)
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (18:50): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: normally, it shouldn't :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:50): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, not sure, it's part of Web DOM Core
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:50): It seems fairly magical.  unknownElement { ... } matches <unknownelement>, right?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:50): doesn't really care much, won't bother investigating :)

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:50): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: selectors need to have two interned strings: one that's compared against HTML-namespace elements and another that's compard for everything else
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:51): (the DOM part, not the Selectors part)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:51): when is Firefox 4 shipping again?
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (18:51): sometimes before the end of 2010

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:52): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: when the sheet belongs to an HTML doc, the CSS parser needs to ascii-lowercase the interned string that's used for HTML comparisons
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:52): oh god http://dev.w3.org/2009/dap/features/
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:52): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=499655
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:52): But then it does the non-HTML comparisons case-sensitively.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:54): I wonder if I should bother hybi with this information
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:56): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: What information?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:58): Seems good to post and remind people what's important to focus on, since the worst that'll happen is they'll ignore it

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:59): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, that nothing happened and that Firefox is on track to ship, but I'm not sure I want to deal with the endless emails that'll undoubtedly follow

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:00): Well no, the worst that will happen is that they will send you long emails about why you are wrong, and you will be drawn into a pointless discussion that ultimatley has no effect, and you will have wasted hours of your life
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:00): And you will turn out to have been right
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:00): You can just ignore any responses that aren't clearly driving the discussion forwards
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:00): And people will keep bemoaning the fact that browsers didn't do what they wanted
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:00): is there any public email about what will ship in Firefox 4 regarding websockets ?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:01): Maybe the browser developers should split off into their own group to focus on what they consider important
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:01): And next time the same thing happens people will mysteriously still ignore you when the same thing happens again
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:02): Erm, too many happens there
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:02): 4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9, there is one, yes
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:02): Call it the WhyBiWG or something
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:02): 4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9, I guess I could try to find it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:03): that was easier than anticipated
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:03): http://www.ietf.org/mail-archive/web/hybi/current/msg04029.html
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:05): that was more than 2 weeks ago, I think plans have changed again

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:06): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: If we call it the WhyBiWG, people will get the wrong idea. And we will probably get the Pope on our backs as well as the IETF. So, I think you are off the naming committee
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:06): 4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9, interesting, are "plans" public?
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:06): I don't know
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:06): you just happen to know them? :)
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:06): I don't remember the timeline but there was a lot of changes
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:07): Seems liek a weird thing to keep secret relative to the other stuff that Mozilla makes public
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:07): I've heard it was not being shipped, shipped with a prefix, shipped behind a pref, shipped by default
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:08): But not necessarily in that order?
